channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: Author Correction: Cycloparaazine, a full-azine carbon nanoring
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63495-y

Author Correction: Cycloparaazine, a full-azine carbon nanoring

item.title: Universal photonic processor for spatial mode decomposition
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63359-5

A reconfigurable photonic integrated circuit for modal decomposition in the Laguerre-Gaussian basis is introduced. The device measures relative phase, amplitude, and partial polarization of the constituting modes. It is capable of distinguishing up to 9 modes, providing a compact next generation platform for beam metrology.
item.dc:title: Universal photonic processor for spatial mode decomposition
item.dc:creator: Varun Sharma
Dorian Brandmüller
Johannes Bütow
Jörg S. Eismann
Peter Banzer
